abstract.p: Bali Co, parent of Sara Lee Corp, names Shahid & Co to handle advertising for its Bali, Barelythere and Wonderbra apparel brands; billings estimated at $10 million; account had been handled by TBWA/Chiat/Day; L'Oreal names LaMicela New York as third ad agency of record for its consumer products division; billings undisclosed (S)

block.p: Two fashion and beauty marketers are making agency changes.

The Bali Company, part of the Sara Lee Corporation, named Shahid & Company in New York to handle advertising for its Bali, Barelythere and Wonderbra apparel brands. Billings were estimated at $10 million. The account had been at the New York office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA unit of the Omnicom Group; Wonderbra since 1994 and Bali and Barelythere since 1998.
Two fashion and beauty marketers are making agency changes.

The Bali Company, part of the Sara Lee Corporation, named Shahid & Company in New York to handle advertising for its Bali, Barelythere and Wonderbra apparel brands. Billings were estimated at $10 million. The account had been at the New York office of TBWA/Chiat/Day, part of the TBWA unit of the Omnicom Group; Wonderbra since 1994 and Bali and Barelythere since 1998.

Peggy Carter, a spokeswoman for the Sara Lee branded apparel operation in Winston-Salem, N.C., attributed the choice to the apparel advertising credentials of Sam Shahid, president and creative director at Shahid; he is best known for campaigns for Abercrombie & Fitch and Calvin Klein.

And L'Oreal in New York named LaMicela New York as a third agency of record for its consumer products division. Billings were not disclosed. LaMicela joins McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising in New York, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies, and Publicis in New York, part of the Publicis Groupe S.A. Nick LaMicela, chief executive and chief creative director at LaMicela, formerly worked for Publicis.
